creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: tea house in center middle ground behind three towering fir trees; path is surrounded by bushes full of pink and white blossoms
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和拾三年作　休み茶屋 {jizuri, Shōwa jūsannen saku, Yasumi chashitsu} | bottom, printed: Tea House in Azalia Garden | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Teahouse
